# MTLMotionBorderMode

**Enumeration**

Options for specifying how the acceleration structure handles timestamps that are outside the specified range.

## Declaration

```swift
enum MTLMotionBorderMode
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLPrimitiveAccelerationStructureDescriptor/motionStartBorderMode] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLPrimitiveAccelerationStructureDescriptor/motionEndBorderMode] properties use this type to describe the behavior for a motion-based object when a timestamp is outside the specified range.

## Specifying motion modes

- **MTLMotionBorderMode.clamp**: A mode that specifies treating times outside the specified endpoint as if they were at the endpoint.
- **MTLMotionBorderMode.vanish**: A mode that specifies that times outside the specified endpoint need to prevent any ray-intersections with the primitive.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Specifying motion behavior

- **motionKeyframeCount**: The number of keyframes in the geometry data.
- **motionStartTime**: The start time for the range of motion that the keyframe data describes.
- **motionEndTime**: The end time for the range of motion that the keyframe data describes.
- **motionStartBorderMode**: The mode to use when handling timestamps before the start time.
- **motionEndBorderMode**: The mode to use when handling timestamps after the end time.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
